body:
`foo.pyx`:
```
#cython: binding=True
cimport cython

def foo(cython.floating[:] x=None):
    return x
```

```
$ cythonize -b foo.pyx && PYTHONFAULTHANDLER=1 pydoc foo
running build_ext
Fatal Python error: Segmentation fault

Current thread 0x00007f8776e03700 (most recent call first):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/inspect.py", line 1803 in _signature_is_functionlike
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/inspect.py", line 2223 in _signature_from_callable
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/inspect.py", line 2737 in from_callable
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/inspect.py", line 2987 in signature
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/pydoc.py", line 1345 in docroutine
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/pydoc.py", line 372 in document
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/pydoc.py", line 1160 in docmodule
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/pydoc.py", line 370 in document
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/pydoc.py", line 1625 in render_doc
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/pydoc.py", line 1632 in doc
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/pydoc.py", line 1895 in help
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/pydoc.py", line 2615 in cli
  File "/usr/bin/pydoc", line 5 in <module>
[1]    15338 segmentation fault (core dumped)  pydoc foo
```
(and similarly when trying `foo.foo?` in IPython)

Arch Linux
Python 3.5.2
Cython version 0.24.1
title: Segfault when accessing signature of a function with optional fusedtype memoryview argument
